newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesian rupiah little changed in late trading.
newsitem.headline: Indonesian rupiah little changed in late trading.

text.p: The Indonesian rupiah was little changed against the dollar in thin turnover on the first trading day of the new fiscal year, dealers said.
"There is not much going on. People seem to have no mood to trade after the long weekend," one local bank dealer said.
The market reopened on Tuesday after a four-day break.
Spot rupiah was hovering in a narrow range and was quoted at 2,400.00/00.50 at 0900 GMT, compared with an opening of 2,400.50/01.50.
Dealers said liquidity was ample, with overnight money falling to seven percent in the afternoon from 14.0 percent.
"But overall sentiment seems to remain firm on the rupiah," the local bank dealer said, adding that swap rates were stable.
Tom/next swaps were at par/0.15 and overnight at -0.1/0.1.
Tomorrow and today rupiah closed at 2,399.5/99.8 and 2,400.0/00.5, respectively. Dealers said the focus was on the new reserve rate which will be effective starting April 16.
One-month swaps were at 10.00/10.50, two at 21.50/22.50, three at 32.5/33.0 and six at 67.0/67.5 points.
Bank Indonesia raised its intervention band by one point to 2,395/2,587 and the conversion band to 2,395/2,443 on Tuesday.
